topic.title: Zeronet Search Engines Don't Work for Me
topic.body: I'm probably doing something wrong but when I click on the button for zeronet search engines, nothing happens.

topic.title: Why 2 Zeronet Wikis
topic.body: I notice that there are two zeronet wikis but they are a clone of each other and both are editable. If one was to edit one of them which one should they edit?

topic.title: Why are only of of the 15 trackers .onion Trackers?
topic.body: I was wondering why only one of the 15 trackers were .onion trackers. I was thinking for better privacy, that one might want it reversed, i.e. 14 .onion trackers and 1 clearnet tracker.

1536996506_1J2sR4SBGqowvrAGW2gmfyd1BsjQL.body:
> [blurhy](#comment_115_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): which Search Engine

Any of the ones listed on the zeronet wiki. However, if you know one that works better then please kindly supply me the link :)

> [blurhy](#comment_120_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): My search engine Horizon http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CjMsvhJ2JsV4B5qo3FDHnF3mvRCcHuxBn/

It's not loading now. Maybe I'll try again later.

> [kaffie](#comment_682_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Kaffiene should work fine. If it doesn't, please let me know.

Kaffine, seems to be working now. When I first tried it nothing happened when I typed "math" into the search bar. Now, when I type math three items come up automatically. Pressing "enter" doesn't seem to do anything.

1536996865_1J2sR4SBGqowvrAGW2gmfyd1BsjQL.body: The trackers that start with Zero:// show an ip address so I think they rely on an exit node, which is less efficient. Anyway, I like the idea of some balance between privacy and speed, so I thought I higher percentage of .onion trackers might be one way to adjust this skew.

> [blurhy](#comment_123_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): You can use tor as the proxy for tracker connections, config page

I don't think that really answers my question but I thought I'd try it. I get the following error:
Invalid value of Custom socks proxy address for trackers: tor (does not matches /.+:[0-9]+/) 

Zeronet does say that I have Tor Enabled and working so I'm not sure what the issue is.

> [blurhy](#comment_125_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): Uh,it's a bug that i've posted it on Github.
by exiting and going back to the page I was able to fix this using the "custom" setting, setting the socks port to 9050, which is the default socks port for tor.

1537072984_15emDktbvC4dppRCwuph3Q3qCBsyd.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_96_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): *Orbot

I do have orbit installed but it is my understanding that unless you set up the control port correctly then one is only tunneling through tor rather then interacting with other tor nodes as a hidden service. It may be that one has to correctly set up the control port to talk to onion trackers.

> [styromaniac](#comment_97_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): It's called Orbot.

Oh, I see. It's a spelling error. Anyway, regarding the cookie premission problems, I think I'm going to try using zeronet via termux instead of the android ap. This way both tor and zeronet will be the same user so I should be able to read the cookie.

> [mappedmind](#comment_12_1J2sR4SBGqowvrAGW2gmfyd1BsjQLh1kme): Oh, I see. It's a spelling error. Anyway, regarding the cookie premission problems, I think I'm going to try using zeronet via termux instead of the android ap. This way both tor and zeronet will be the same user so I should be able to read the cookie.

Sweet, by using termux I can use tor with zeronet on android. :D (without rooting my phone)

1533831712_1Q5U8WerBKjVkN2aLMWH1ckmJFu5e.body:
> [oiuytd](#comment_4_1EFHNZxRQ3QB5rhSuKbqVHKo3JMTWdhfFk): Freenet is dead. Most of the content I find there is 20+ years old

fms (Freenet Messaging System), is by far the best darknet discussion forum platform. Plus freenet has better security. The biggest downside of freenet is that it takes more computer resources to run, and ZeronNet has the advantage of being faster. Also freenet only works well on linux, in my opinion. Zeronet Works well on many Operating systems.

> [arcana](#comment_3_1KBAjH3997VWYR8T215JrzfPit9MRcbWf1): FreeNet,  [...]

I disagree. I think the content on freenet is quite stable.There is also a lot of new content in the discussion forums "fms" and "sone". Search sucks on freenet but is okay on the fms archive and there is also an index site on freenet that has very good keyword features.

1536324263_14WGRwSbM55c5DuiSCME94BTj6Goz.body: Could one set up a private tracker that only these two machines know about?

1536424390_14RCTJp4ozmDH2c49CxmC98Mfp1fs.body: I suspect the imagined scenario is the case where someone on clearnet has identified your ip address, and then you connect to them on Tor. I don't know if zeronet contains any fingerprints like this or not. However, even if it did a third party couldn't observer who you were talking to on tor regardless of when or not you took the above suggested precaution.

1537263801_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6n.body: So I added the extension, now do you have any good gopher URLs???

Seems like overbite is just a proxy. What about a terminal based gopher cleint?
https://github.com/kieselsteini/cgo/
